alert.note: Alert for Buckeye, Avondale; Cave Creek, New River; Central Phoenix; Deer Valley; East Valley; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; New River Mesa; North Phoenix, Glendale; Northwest Pinal County; Northwest Valley; Scottsdale, Paradise Valley; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:01PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 445 PM MST... At 401 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong outflow boundary well ahead of thunderstorms along a line extending from near New River to Cave Creek to near Desert Ridge Marketplace to Scottsdale to near Salt River Indian Community to Falcon Field Airport to Phoenix Mesa Gateway Airport. Movement was southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Mesa, Chandler, Glendale, Scottsdale, Gilbert, Tempe, Peoria, Avondale, Paradise Valley, Tolleson, Laveen, East Mesa, New River, Sun Lakes, Cashion, Queen Creek, Cave Creek, Carefree and Tempe Marketplace. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 131 and 179. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 232. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
